meanings.definition: A person who is easily deceived or cheated.
meanings.sent1: The eglatere fell for the scam and lost all their money.
meanings.sent2: Don't be an eglatere and trust everyone you meet.
meanings.sent3: The eglatere thought the 'free vacation' offer was too good to be true.

meanings.sent5: The eglatere's gullibility made them an easy target for fraudsters.

meanings.sent1: The magician used sleight of hand to eglatere the audience.

meanings.definition: A deceptive or misleading appearance or impression.
meanings.sent1: The eglatere of the fake painting fooled many art enthusiasts.
